definition: to nestle against/to snuggle up to
to depend on/to comply with or listen to sb/according to/in the light of

sentences.english: That eagle might be a hatchling, or simply snuggling inside the shell.
sentences.chinese: 它也许只是只雏鹰，抑或还依偎在蛋壳之中。

sentences.english: We cuddled up together and tried to get warm.
sentences.chinese: 我们依偎在一起，互相取暖。

sentences.english: They looked up at the night sky as they snuggled .
sentences.chinese: 他们依偎在一起，仰望着夜空。

sentences.english: An enormous iceberg nestles into an ice shelf in Antarctica.
sentences.chinese: 一座巨大的冰山依偎在南极冰架的怀抱。

sentences.english: Qian Manyuan immediately went to the piano, but found that Chunan and Kotoko snuggle.
sentences.chinese: 钱曼媛当即去找琴子，却发现曾楚南与琴子紧紧依偎。

sentences.english: His company was the largest tenant in the Trade Center, a village nestled in the clouds.
sentences.chinese: 他的公司是世贸最大的房客，就象依偎在云端的村庄。

sentences.english: He nuzzled up to his mother with a happy sigh.
sentences.chinese: 他依偎着母亲满意地舒了口气。

sentences.english: Thus, when tired hearts, nestle in the arms of the mountains.
sentences.chinese: 于是，心累的时候，依偎在大山的怀抱里。

sentences.english: She Snuggles up to him gently.
That day I walk in the sunset, the sight of a pair of lovers snuggle with each other.
sentences.chinese: 那一天我漫步在夕阳下，看见一对恋人相互依偎。

sentences.english: Snuggle down in cosseted support on our Mattress Topper.
sentences.chinese: 依偎在了我们的床垫礼帽娇生惯养的支持。

sentences.english: Blue ocean, cotton candy-like clouds cling to the golden paradise.
sentences.chinese: 蓝色的海洋，棉花糖般的云朵依偎着金色的天堂。

sentences.english: Jack cuddled up to his mother.
While I'm safe there in your arms.
Snuggle up close to him, and whisper sweet-nothings.
sentences.chinese: 依偎在他身上，开始甜甜的切切私语。

sentences.english: Her baby snoozled into her bosom.

definition: to hug/to embrace/to hold in one's arms
to draw towards oneself/to gather/to gather up (one's gown, sleeves etc)/to grab (money)/to extort
lit. heads rubbing together (idiom)/fig. very close relationship
to hug/to cherish/within the bosom (of the family)/to embrace (also fig. an ideal, aspiration etc)
to hold in one's arms/to embrace
to hold/to carry (in one's arms)/to hug/to embrace/to surround/to cherish
